author: Evan Sun
text: 'Noodles were decent but nothing special.. the broth was okay as well.. nothing really stands out with this ramen dish.. service is average.. I would say if you can skip it
column5: skip it.. maybe better ramen spots in Hoboken'

author: Jackie Seith
text: 'Amazing poke - I‚Äôve tried all in Hoboken and by far south street has the best. Huge portions and the ingredients are so fresh'

author: Nasrin Nahnooch
text: 'I visited a few days ago
column5: and was really new to Hoboken and came in not really knowing what to eat. But I was soon greeted by lovely staff
column6: specially one by the name of Sara who explained the menu piece by piece and was patient enough to help me through
column7: what I can eat without compromising my allergy reactions. Will be visiting again soon !!!'

author: stephanie lopez
text: 'worst place. 40$ for two bowls of ramen. definitely not worth it'

author: Natalie Nikolaieva
text: 'Above and beyond! You guys are rock!\nSo yummy! Food is super fresh
column5: tasty and healthy. Service is good
column6: staff is friendly and the whole place is clean!  Nice! I love it here! ‚ú®üî•'

author: Andrew Park
text: 'many different ramens to choose from. the broth can be slighlty hotter in a rainy day. I liked there signature spicy ramen'

author: Ginette B
text: "I come here for Poke. It's always very fresh with great portions. I like the premade combinations such as the spicy tuna because it has spicy mayo
column5: guacamole
column6: and mangos plus much more. Less for me to think about it. This is my friends favorite place for Poke too."

author: Nivesh Kalra
text: "Called them to check if noodles contains egg and their response..I don't know! Not friendly customer experience."

author: Tran Thai
text: "The service was extremely terrible
column5: I have never experienced anything like this before. When we got to the place
column6: we were rudely told by the employee (girl with red hair) that they were closing soon in a rude tone. My girlfriend said that we thought they were closing at 9:30PM and it was only around 8PM
column7: she said yes they close at 9:30PM but they were still about to close. And then we asked if it is okay if we can eat here and she responded rudely and said sure. As she was taking our order
column8: she was scrolling through her phone and singing to the song over the speaker
column9: which is extremely unprofessional. Then she took a century to swipe my card because she didn't know how the machine worked. Never coming back again and surprised this is located in Hoboken. The food was decent

author: Rachel Cipkins
text: 'Large portions excellent food'

author: Kouryou Ngin
text: "Always love the food here. Always fresh and absolutely delicious. I've only had their sushi burrito but it's amazing. I heard the ramen and poke bowl is great too from friends!"

author: Ariana Slater
text: 'ramen was underwhelming
column5: no ambiance very dead inside'

author: Sophia T
text: 'Great ramen!'

author: Ellen
text: 'Soft boiled egg is hard boiled.\nBraised pork? Barely blanched. Tough and has no flavor whatsoever.\nSoup has this fake umami
column5: greasy sweetness that stayed in tastebud for age.\n\nOnly saving grace is the noodle
column6: and the large potion of the clearly priorly frozen seafood.'

author: Melissa Zoleta
text: 'Delicious ramen and pork bao bun
column5: so much flavor.  Highly recommended comfort food'

author: Angela
text: 'Got the poke bowl and ended up throwing up 30 minutes after eating it. The salmon looked a strange color to begin with
column5: and the inside of the restaurant didn‚Äôt look the cleanest either.'

author: Sandra isabel Velasquez
text: 'This place is a joke and can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs located in Hoboken! They send me a rotten food yesterday I called them and the guy who answered said I had to call Uber it‚Äôs because is not their responsibility
column5: So nobody  helped and I had no food yesterday paying lots of fees for my food Thru UberEats
column6: I don‚Äôt recommend this place stay away'

author: Red Chris TV
text: 'The food had a bad flavor
column5: the egg was rotten and this guys said they cant help me
column6: 30 dollars for a rotten ramen

author: Latia Bates
text: 'I ordered today for delivery and as I immediately opened my container of the hot and spicy ramen (fire pulled pork)
column5: I got a horrible stench. It was a very heavy
column6: foul smell. I was making excuses for this dish and telling my husband it must be the seaweed but then I took a bite of the egg and gagged. Not only was the outside brown
column7: the inside was too. My entire bowl is rotten and my daughter ordered the same thing. We just cant eat it and I will not take a chance. 30+ dollars down the drain. This was our last order.'

author: Amanda Barron
text: 'Got a sushi burrito with shrimp tempura
column5: mango
column6: peanut sauce
column7: and black rice. Amazing! I split it with my gf but next time I will definitely be getting my own. Half of one was very filling but I wanted more because it just tasted that good!'

author: Andrew Price
text: 'Left is the south street special
column5: right it a custom bowl (half rice/half salad
column6: chicken

author: Humberto Guzman (RavenGoreHG)
text: "Had their Prized Catch Sushi Burrito thing today. And it was incredible. Wish i could eat it everyday. But I've also tried their ramen. And its just as good. Highly recommend."

author: David Rhee
text: 'Service is good and food is solid..'

author: Flonirhgi Hart
text: 'I celebrated my nomination last night in this fine place. happy to tell that we had a awesome evening and the venue was undoubtedly one of the reasons for this successful evening. The team  cooperated in a lovely style
column5: the meals were delicious and my guests were very  glad. We shall no dout return for more events. Thank you very much.'

author: George Fine
text: 'Not terrible
column5: but by no means
column6: nothing great either ... the soup was small and flavor a bit too salty and flat ...'

author: Dan Santoro
text: 'This is not a hidden gem
column5: this is a GEM GEM.\nIf Naruto tried this
column6: he would slap Teuchi in his face.  Tell your friends
column8: let them know this is the only spot for any type of Noodles/Soup/Asian Cuisine you will tolerate from this point on.  If you are still reading this I‚Äôm highly disappointed because you could have been on your way to get this ramen right now and the fact that you waisted even more time is a mistake.  GO NOW...'

author: Mikhail K
text: 'Ramen was pretty good
column5: but it wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúramen‚Äù in my understanding
column6: just some seafood soup'

author: Emily Wong
text: 'Pretty good poke bowls but ramen is okay. They are quick with orders and have big servings'

author: Kevin Burke
text: "It's the worst ramen I've ever had. There's too many options around here just avoid at all costs"

author: Lisa Clemmings
text: 'Lisa Clemmings here. Hi dolls. I was so upset with this ramen experience that I had to find the closest bar to drink off the shambles that was this ramen house. I drank my sorrows away the rest of the night. If I get sick tonight it won‚Äôt be because I drank too much.'

author: Trish Laureano
text: 'Do NOT come here !! Our eggs were clearly old to the point where it is dangerous to even try eating them. They were brown and I didn‚Äôt even realize they were eggs until my boyfriend pointed it out. Everything tasted store bought and I too can throw old ingredients in a salty broth and call it the best ramen in Hoboken.'

author: Daniel Lane
text: 'Came here thinking this was the best ramen house in Hoboken in accordance with the reviews. The noodles were clearly store bought and resembled cheap spaghetti. The eggs were brown to the extent you could not even recognize that they‚Äôre eggs. Overall the dish was well below average. Find another place.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "My fianc√© and I came in with my parents for a late-ish lunch at around 2 pm on a Sunday. There was one other couple dining there and no one ordering takeout. Already not a good sign. We had noticed that this place was always empty
column5: so we never gave it a chance until this day. They serve ramen and poke bowls (odd
column6: I know)
column8: and they bring it to you.\n\nMy parents had the Original Ton Men (braised pork
column16: roasted onion flakes). I had the Fire Chili Miso Ton Men (Fired pulled pork
column23: roasted onion flakes.) It was basically just a slightly spicy version of the original ton men but with pulled pork instead. I feel like most of the ingredients didn't really go together. It was more like 'whatever they could find that is Asian and seems like it could go into a bowl of ramen' ramen. It didn't taste bad
column24: but it was just odd. I did appreciate that they didn't overcook the noodles though. My fianc√© created his own poke bowl. The color of his spicy tuna was a fiery hot orange
column25: like a flaming hot Cheeto. Looked pretty questionable
column26: but it didn't taste off. It just tasted like they added a lot of stuff to it to hide any fishiness. I probably wouldn't risk ordering anything raw from here again
column27: especially not with so many other poke places popping up in Hoboken now.\n\nIn fact
column28: I probably wouldn't visit again. I'd probably prefer the dried ramen noodles. I too can haphazardly throw random ingredients into a bowl."

author: Joseph Fung
text: 'Try all of the ramen choices here. Best ramen in Hudson County and a good peer to many in Manhattan.'

author: Roger Heil
text: "Spaghetti noodles
column5: egg was cold
column6: seafood was cooked well but that's about it."

author: Reggie Bourdeau
text: 'Ramen to die for'

author: vlog on a buget
text: 'Very nice workers and great food'

author: Britton Gibson
text: 'Food is good however the portions are very small!  I ordered a bowl with Chicken as my protein. When I got it back to my office
column5: I realized I had 6 small bites of chicken. For a $12.00 lunch
column6: I expect to have more than 6 small bites. Also
column7: this is not the first time I have had to say something about the portion sizes. Beware that if your hungry for meat this might not be the place for you.'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Really good poke bowls with huge portions. I created my own bowl and everything was very fresh and tasty. I haven‚Äôt tried the ramen yet but would definitely recommend the poke bowls.'

author: Greedy V2
text: 'Rats'

author: Aaron Beveridge
text: 'Absolutely love these bowls. Forbidden rice makes it. The low rating is because they get the order wrong more than 50% of the time in delivery orders. And we have nicely provided that feedback to them. They either send the wrong drinks
column5: or send salmon in the bowl instead of Ahi tuna
column6: or forget the sauce (very frequent).'

author: Hudson Shi
text: 'delicious'

author: Nicholas Alonso
text: "Very tasty
column5: I'd probably give it 5 stars if I hadn't just been in Japan getting Michelin star ramen there."

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: 'The noodles were scrumptious
column5: the eggs were delish
column6: the rectangular flat things were bangin
column8: and the broth was oh so slurpable. All adjectives aside
column9: this place is now a top 5 for me in Hoboken. Really good all around. (Picture is Soy Ramen with chicken broth)'

author: Max Pargament
text: 'I order from South Street almost every week. The portions are good
column5: the food is tasty
column6: and the price is right...very solid lunch spot.\nAlso the staff is generally friendly (especially Dan - who I believe is the manager).'

author: John Geldart
text: 'Love this place
column5: great food
column6: never had any complaints ever.'

author: David Hsu
text: 'I eat here at least once a week for lunch. Noodles with braised pork always hits the spot. The soup broth is exceptional.  It makes my top 10 restaurant list for NJ.'

author: Michael Rabadi
text: "Should at least have table service. Food tastes old. The eggs are good. Spicy vegetable ramen is okay. I just wouldn't suggest ordering meat. Wish the food was made fresh from scratch."

author: Jessica Chen
text: 'I tried two things here. Pork Ton Men is rich and flavorful. There is a fairly large piece of pork and a good amount of noodles. Egg is soft and I love the bamboo shoots & bean sprouts. There‚Äôs minced onion in there too
column5: which is a bit strange. Pork bao is great a value for $4.50 with two large pieces of meat. The meat was so big that the bao fell apart after two bites üòÖ It‚Äôs not quite as good as my favorite ramen spot in NYC but it‚Äôs probably the best in the Hoboken JC neighborhood.'

author: Jason Manenkoff
text: 'Ehh. The seafood ramen was more like a jumble mix of little frozen seafood with a thick milky broth sort of like clam chowder. Wouldn‚Äôt come back. Ani ramen in JC way better.'

author: Brian Spain
text: 'This is my favorite poke place out of the 4 I know about in Hoboken and Jersey City. However
column5: I have not tried the new one in the Newport Mall
column6: so once I try that one
column7: I will update this review. I feel like the portions here have gotten smaller over the last year
column8: but I still always leave. Well worth the visit.'

author: Maria Hernandez
text: 'Great staff and great food!!!'

author: Chetana
text: 'Hot and spicy ramen and spicy tuna poke bowl were delicious. Would definitely go here again!'

author: Hector Torres
text: 'The food was great
column5: maybe a but overpriced for ramen but overall it was good'

author: Tomie Beatrice
text: 'The spicy sesame vegetarian ramen is a must try & reasonably priced. I enjoyed how every ingredient go together. The broth was flavorful but lukewarm. I would prefer if the broth was hot rather than warm. Hot ramen makes the whole experience more enjoyable for me.'

author: Laura Saravia
text: 'Food here is amazing
column5: very tasty!'

author: Scott Lagattuta
text: 'Best Ramin in town'

author: P Wong
text: "Good ramen
column5: decent pok√© bowls. The portions are very generous but quality is not consistent. The service is also very bratty and uppity. I get it
column6: the pay is probably not very high. But I'm not here to deal with attitude AND incorrect pronunciations of the toppings. I'm just trying to make my own pok√© bowl!"

author: Emily Luedeman
text: 'Absolutely love this place after the first takeout.  My crab poke bowl was so delicious. My husband got ramen and loved it but walked back up to get another crab poke bowl for himself after trying mine.  Prices are very reasonable too for the quality'

author: Sean Glendon
text: "I'm not an expert when it comes to Ramen or Poke but I really enjoy both options from South Street. Very flavorful dishes that come in large portions. I definitely would recommend."

author: V T
text: 'Ordered Spicy Tuna dish and a pork broth ramen.  Both smelled foul so had to throw away.  The uber eats driver Dilon was also drunk.  Never order again from this restaurant.'

author: Dev Chatterjee
text: "I'm mixed. I didn't find the ramen good but the poke was good."

author: Isobel Cave
text: "Cold
column5: expensive food that took 90 minutes to arrive. Don't order delivery from here."

author: Allison Ehrhart
text: "BEST poke bowls in town because they are so huge and reasonably priced. The only poke bowl in town I struggle to finish - most other places leave me wanting more. The service is a little slow as I've had to wait even when I've ordered ahead. But will still always recommend and will keep coming back!"

author: Charles Hu
text: 'Loved everything about it'

author: Victor C
text: 'Had the miso pork and it was excellent. Needed a little bit of seasoning that they have in the front. The piece of pork was perfect. Not too fatty

text: 'Great food and quick'

text: 'Very good'

text: 'Food was incredible! Generous portions. Quality service.'

author: Kai
text: 'I was there with my wife on Saturday night but we never had to wait to place our order. Exceptional service
column5: great ramen! Very affordable. Highly recommended'

author: Anna Kassymova
text: 'Good ramen
column5: good service
column6: recommend)'

author: Anthony Jaffee
text: 'Delicious ramen and best poke bowls I‚Äôve had anywhere. Relaxing atmosphere too makes for great place to grab lunch or dinner. Isn‚Äôt cheap
column5: but nothing is in Hoboken and you get good quality and filling portions. Great place.'

author: Kyria Johnson
text: "Pretty good ramen.  I got the ton men ramen.  Traditional pork bone broth
column5: a little too oily but flavor was good.  I'm not a huge fan of their noodles
column6: a little oddly shaped and the texture doesn't soften quite right.  The sliced pork was decent
column7: very moist but lacking a bit in flavor.  The added veggies were a bit odd (the overabundance of raw onion wasn't too pleasant).  The real deal maker was the egg (they give you an entire egg) it was perfect.  Overall this is the best ramen you can find in town currently.  Will return to try some of the other options"

author: Jimmy Poletaev
text: 'Alright
column5: listen up folks. I don‚Äôt just like Ramen
column6: I love it. I love my life in terms of finding the best ramen out there
column7: and no that‚Äôs not a typo. South Street‚Äôs Ramen is my first
column9: and fourth favorite thing to eat in this state. Third is the triple S sushi burrito
column10: also coincidentally on the menu of South Street Ramen. I wont even bother writing anything else. Just got eat it.'

author: Kellie Fitzgerald
text: 'Very delicious. Sparce decor.'

author: Brian Hoo
text: 'Good ramen.  A little pricey but worth it.'

author: Leah Shen

author: Rokotoff
text: 'Recommend'

author: Spesh
text: 'Wow amazing place never had sushi burrito before !! Love it !!! I‚Äôll be back ! Dan keep up great work amazing!!!'

author: Oleg Appassov
text: "Wow
column5: definitely recommend this place to anyone that's a fan of sushi and ramen. The place and atmosphere is very clean
column6: trendy
column7: and chill. I ordered fire chili miso ton men
column8: on a heat scale it's 5 out of 10
column9: if you like spicy food. Also got the south street special sushi burrito and it was delicious. This place is super filling and the price is reasonable.\n\nNote: Not related to the restaurant. All ramen to me has that wet dog smell
column10: if you have the same weird sense of smell
column11: then ask to not include bamboo in your üçú."

author: Laura Desimine
text: 'Delicious ramen and impeccable service!'

author: Ben Marsh
text: 'Great new spot!'

author: Gillibee
text: 'Kinda pricey for ramen but the brazed pork belly is delicious. The Tokyo soy broth is more slaty than I would like.'

author: Jiaren Li
text: "Overall good experience for the price point. Let me preface this by saying I have VERY high standards for ramen and this place's definitely isn't perfect. However
column5: in my two visits the ramen and sushirritos are both satisfying and with good portion
column6: with enough of variety to choose from. The prompt and friendly service and the good environment setup pushed me more towards 5 star than 4."

author: Veronica Gonzalez
text: 'Although i wish there were more options while ordering online (lack of any drinks or sides)  I was very happy with the meal i received. I will be ordering again :)'
